message.content:
cs.CR, cs.SY, cs.SE, cs.PL, cs.AR 

This paper deals with the problem of detecting and mitigating side-channel attacks, which is a common topic in the computer security (cs.CR) and systems (cs.SY) communities. The proposed solution involves a compiler-guided scheduler, which suggests that programming languages and compilers (cs.PL) are also relevant to this work. The paper also discusses the implementation and evaluation of the proposed scheme, which falls under the software engineering (cs.SE) and architecture (cs.AR) categories.
